inc_popup:
Alberta: In 1966, the incidence of Crohn’s disease was 1.73/100,000 and the incidence of ulcerative colitis was 1.3/100,000 (Pinchbeck 1988). The incidence of both diseases rose to 16.5/100,000 and 11/100,000 in 1999 for Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis, respectively (Bernstein 2006), and then began to fall to 10.2/100,000 and 8.4/100,000 in 2012 for Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis, respectively (Kaplan 2018).

British Columbia: In 1999, the incidence of Crohn’s disease was estimated at 8.8/100,000 and the incidence of ulcerative colitis was estimated at 9.9/100,000 (Bernstein 2006).
